title: Adaptive Immune Receptor Repertoire Analysis
description: Comprehensive B-cell and T-cell receptor (BCR/TCR) repertoire sequencing analysis using the Immcantation framework. Supports bulk and single-cell AIRR-seq with V(D)J annotation, clonal analysis, and lineage reconstruction. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq_1,fastq_2`
content:
AIRRflow - Adaptive Immune Receptor Repertoire Analysis

End-to-end bioinformatics pipeline for analyzing B-cell and T-cell receptor repertoire sequencing data using the AIRR-community certified Immcantation framework. Supports targeted bulk and single-cell AIRR sequencing, plus TCR/BCR extraction from RNA-seq datasets.

What is AIRRflow?

AIRRflow enables comprehensive characterization of adaptive immune receptor repertoires, revealing clonal diversity, somatic hypermutation patterns, and lineage relationships critical for understanding immune responses, vaccine development, and immunotherapy.

Key Features

  • AIRR Community Certified: Compliant with AIRR standards
  • Immcantation Framework: Industry-standard tools integrated
  • Multi-Protocol Support: Bulk, single-cell, RNA-seq compatible
  • Complete Workflow: From raw reads to clonal lineages
  • UMI Processing: Molecular identifier support
  • Flexible Configuration: Customizable for various protocols

Pipeline Workflow

  1. QC and Assembly: Quality control, adapter trimming, read filtering
  2. Read Pairing: Mate pair assembly and consensus building
  3. UMI Processing: Molecular barcode handling (optional)
  4. V(D)J Annotation: Gene segment assignment with IgBLAST
  5. Quality Filtering: Remove non-productive and low-quality sequences
  6. Clonal Analysis: Define clones and reconstruct germline
  7. Lineage Trees: Build B-cell lineage phylogenies
  8. Repertoire Analysis: Diversity metrics and custom reports

Scientific Applications

  • Immunology Research: Study adaptive immune responses
  • Vaccine Development: Track antibody evolution
  • Cancer Immunotherapy: Analyze T-cell repertoires
  • Autoimmune Disease: Characterize pathogenic clones
  • Infection Studies: Monitor antigen-specific responses

Analysis Features

  • V(D)J Annotation: Precise gene segment identification
  • Clonal Grouping: Identify related sequences
  • Germline Reconstruction: Infer unmutated ancestors
  • Somatic Hypermutation: Quantify mutation patterns
  • Lineage Trees: Phylogenetic reconstruction
  • Diversity Metrics: Clonality and repertoire diversity

Input Requirements

  • FASTQ Files: Raw sequencing reads (paired or single-end)
  • Assembled Sequences: Pre-assembled contigs (optional)
  • Sample Sheet: CSV with sample metadata
  • Reference Database: IMGT germline gene database
  • Protocol Info: Library preparation details

Main Outputs

  • Annotated Sequences: V(D)J assignments and alignment
  • Clonal Clusters: Grouped related sequences
  • Germline Sequences: Reconstructed ancestors
  • Lineage Trees: Phylogenetic relationships
  • Diversity Metrics: Clonality and repertoire statistics
  • QC Reports: Comprehensive quality summaries

Perfect for: Immunology • BCR/TCR Sequencing • Vaccine Development • Immunotherapy • Antibody Discovery
